website_summaries.verdict: Plenty of users are more than happy with the value they get from this oven.
pros: A very attractive, bright stainless steel appliance with a glass lid, the kind of cookware that fits in with just about any kitchen décor
cons: will be plenty for some, but not for larger families

customer_reviews.title: It is a beautiful pot and I love it but I feel that ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this pot about 3 times. The third time the metal on the bottom of the pan pitted. I don't know if the underlying metal is safe. I use this to cook pasta and I am afraid the boiling water will pick up metals from the pitted areas that might be harmful. This happened two days after the Amazon return window. It is a beautiful pot and I love it but I feel that I wasted $60.00. Very unhappy!
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this 5qt Cuisinart SS...
customer_reviews.text: After one use, the pot had black pits inside, on the bottom of pan. The metal this pan is made with, is reacting to the food being cooked in it. I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: farmsteader

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I like the size. But i used it just one time and it becomes like thins
customer_reviews.author: Claire k.

customer_reviews.title: dark spots after one use
customer_reviews.text: After using once to make pasta I got dark black spots on the bottom. This is something I'd expect to MAYBE happen after many uses. Hoping to get a refund or replacement
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks are deceiving!
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a quality stainless skillet, and Cuisinart makes great food processors, but save your money! I followed the instructions to use medium heat because of the high aluminum content in the base, but there was no mention of the paper-thin aluminum sides. Olive oil immediately burned onto the sides of the pan and my croutons burnt. No amount of scrubbing would get it clean. I’ve tossed the pan and chalked the price up to sad experience. Back to the reliable All Clad!
customer_reviews.author: K. Pirnie

customer_reviews.title: Favorite pan in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, this is my all-time favorite saucepan. It is a perfect size and weight. Its finish remains shiny through repeated washings. The interior stainless finish is extremely easy to clean and I would prefer it any day to nonstick. The lid is almost the best part with the straining capability, and its tight fit almost allows waterless cooking. I reach for this pan so often, I purchased another.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain shopper

customer_reviews.title: Rust, rust and more rust
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was a way I could give zero stars to these awful pots. There is so much red spot rust on them that I can't use them anymore. Cuisinart is a useless company, they have been bought by Conair and they are not helping me. It is money down the drain. Garbage. Always check if stainless steel is actually 18/8. These are supposedly stainless steel, but they are not 18/8. Low quality, rust holding.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Versatile but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because of the versatility of the pour spout, the attractive look, the low(er) price point, and because I have had luck with Cuisinart cookware in the past. It does the job I need it to do (which is simply boiling water, not actually cooking), but within a few weeks of use the stainless interior was pitting and staining. I don't have hard water, it has been gently used, and I have never had this problem with my All-Clad stainless cookware. I decided to keep it because it does the job, but I will consider the quality the next time I need to make a similar purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Meg's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Don’t let the 4 star rating fool you.
customer_reviews.text: These are the WORST pots and pans I’ve ever used. Impossible to clean. Can’t cook anything in and it not stick. Literally was cooking bacon and couldn’t even turn the bacon because it was already fused to the bottom of the pan. Waste of money and I am very unhappy with my purchase. Also have noticed the black spots other people keep talking about it appearing all my stuff as well. Don’t buy! They are pretty but 100% worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Braiden Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality it used to be, pitted almost immediately with very little use
customer_reviews.text: Not the quality they used to be, pitted almost immediately with very little use. This was such a disappointment since I have a similar set bought years ago that have never pitted. Reading reviews, this isn't a unique issue to just the set I received. Wish that I'd taken time to read reviews before buying. Instead, I relied on past experience & only to discover that something has changed for the worse. They look nice, but won't last long if they're pitting from the start.
customer_reviews.author: angelluv

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: We already own some Cuisinart cookware and I purchased this large set to replace some other pans and round out our collection. I used one pot from our set and it pitted with the first use and is noticeably lighter than our other Cuisinart pots. Feels like an $8 pan from Walmart :( Will be returning and I am disappointed in Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: Just got it. Ok, I am back again.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this pan, only used it three times. It is not the time to give it an honest review yet. Now, that I have used this pot several more times I am beginning to see these gray spots on the inside of the pan as though the steel is coming off. This not acceptable. I dont want any metal going into my food. This pan is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Martin

customer_reviews.title: already staining horribly after 2 months of very mild use
customer_reviews.text: **Update** So it took a ton of time but after finally getting used to these as my first stainless cooking set. I actually love them! haha. You have to ensure not to use extremely high heat (I never go above medium) as well as be generous with oil. Other than that, they work great. ---------------I'm not really a fan of these. They stick badly, already staining horribly after 2 months of very mild use. I've reached out to thee Cuisinart team, but talking to them is like pulling teeth. I've had to email three separate people at this point and still feel like the item exchange is not completed right.
customer_reviews.author: tea710

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: So Far So Good Received in near light speed, as described and in excellent condition. Ask me about Quality, Durability, and Versatility in about 12 months. By that time I will have put it through most anything that goes on in a kitchen of a restaurant. I have owned and operated numerous restaurants and I cook from scratch. They will get a work out, I guarantee it! Rating shows 5 Stars, and as I said aske me in 12 months, I gave no rating what so ever. How could anyone give an honest rating without putting it to the test? Again, ask me in 12 Months!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The wife loves them and uses them several times a week!
customer_reviews.text: We have several of these in different sizes. My wife loves them and uses them several times a week! We will never use anything else. As with any stainless item we NEVER put them in the dishwasher. Harsh dishwasher cleaners will trash any stainless. We already learned the hard way. The only issue we have seen over a couple of years is a handle rivet on one of them started getting loose. Very easy to remedy. Took it to the vice and after a couple of whacks with a small ball peen it is good as new.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Get Your Cuisnart on Home Chef
customer_reviews.text: I love Cuisnart cookware because it is great on my gas stove. Handles get warm but not scalding hot. I cook a lot! Like I am the sista’ who cooks 40 pounds of potato salad and 12 pounds of collard greens for family events. If you are a home cook who burns like I do, get some Cuisnart cookware. The rest just cannot compete.
customer_reviews.author: Lady of the House

customer_reviews.title: Well made quality cookware
customer_reviews.text: This dutch oven is very well made and is a perfect size for making a pot of soup. It washes up well and so far has proven to be a quality piece of cookware. I needed something larger than a 3 qt. saucepan and glad I went with the 5 qt. A 4 qt. wouldn't have been enough bigger to make a difference. I recommend this dutch oven & purchased a stainless one due to having a smooth cooktop that can't have cast iron used on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SORRY SO BRIEF MY WRIST HURTS FROM SCRUBBING THESE PANS
customer_reviews.text: The product is terrible, I’m not sure what the great reviews are for, either bought reviews or reviews on another product. Tried to file a claim starting 12/11 via telephone after being on hold for over an hour I took the email/online option AND still haven’t heard from an representative. (Today is 12/17) Don’t waste your time or money. These pans in the photos were only ever used three times total ALL we’re cooking eggs...
customer_reviews.author: Jennnnnn

customer_reviews.title: A Great Addition
customer_reviews.text: I was actually looking or the 1.5 quart sauce pan, but Cuisinart no longer makes it. When I saw this one, only .5 quart larger, I thought I would give it a try. I actually love the draining feature. Never having had a pot that had a pour spout and a lid that had a built in liquid strainer, I was a bit concerned. But no more! I am sold! I love that I don't need to dirty a strainer for pasta, and I can drain my veggies. A great invention!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: WORST STAINLESS POT EVER! Finish chipped after a few months!
customer_reviews.text: I had originally given this 5 stars but a few months after purchase, the stainless began flaking off inside! I've used stainless cookware all my life, never had this problem.Seems this pot is made to last as long as the return policy before it starts failing. It's useless now. Who wants metal in their food? Very disappointed because I am stuck with a pot I can't return or use. Probably toss it in the trash. This company used to be known for their quality cookware. Cheaply made junk is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Bookinchworm

customer_reviews.title: Super nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift for my dad, who is picky about everything. He loved them and said they were better than the Emril pans he had previously. Those did last about 7 years so we will see how these stand the rest of time. He loved the noodle pot as that was not in many if the other sets he's owed in the past. That pot alone makes this set amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Silhouette
customer_reviews.text: This is a noce pot. It's a great size for my needs, perfect for large pots of soup, boiling water for pasta, thr list goes on and on. The shape of the pot is unique and beautiful with the stainless steel shine. I like that the lid is glass and the handle is easy to grip. I wish the pot was thicker and had a bit more weight to it. It is a very thin and lightweight stainless steel. I thought with it being cuisinart brand it would be heavier like my other cuisinart pieces.
customer_reviews.author: philyaw

customer_reviews.title: Does not perform like genuine Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: This set was nothing like the cuisinart pan I got at a kitchen store. Food of all types sticks terribly to these pans and we've followed the directions very carefully. They are impossible to clean--even the steam from the pans sticks and creates brown residue on the sides of the pan when it is on low heat. We have been told that we mayhave gotten "seconds"--pans that say "Cuisinart" and look the same, but are made from an inferior metal/material. What can we do?
customer_reviews.author: F. D.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my Cuisinart Cookware set!
customer_reviews.text: This way my first set of ss pans and I couldn't be happier. They are beautiful and amazing. I noticed the difference my cooking immediately. There is not beating the difference in technology when you compare what I had to this Cuisinart set. If you know what you are doing food will never stick. The food I cook never stuck to bottom of pan like some reviewers complain about. If it is sticking, doing a little google search and figure out what you are doing wrong. I wouldn't want anyone who is considering purchasing such an amazing set of pots and pans that could last them for years be detoured by commenters saying there food sticks...
customer_reviews.author: MariS

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, Practical and Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: What a perfect little pot! A real beauty! Made a cherry compote in it day after I got it and it cooked wonderfully! Clean up was easy peasy! Great quality! I'm looking forward to using it more! I think this will be my new go to pot for small batch cooking! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: won't work on nuwave
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan because, all stainless steel pans work on nuwave cook tops. not so with cuisinart brand. It did have enought steel in it to start the stove, I left it on 450 for 20 Min. never boiled water, never got hot. I am very disapointed that the stainless steel pan is not stainless steel but some cheep material.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne B. Lovell

customer_reviews.title: Great pan!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pan! When making baked ziti, I usually add ground beef, sausage, mushrooms and onions in addition to the sauce. The 3 quart pan I had was usually filled to the rim so when i tried to stir it, I inevitably spilled some onto my stove top. Problem solved by going to a 5 quart pan - the extra capacity is wonderful. I'm not a savvy enough cook to know if it is heating uniformly, so I will defer to other reviews for comments of that nature. Suffice it to say, I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Not just a shiney pan.Cuisinart Quality !
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this pan.On gas range low/med flame, it heats very fast/even,handle remains cool/warm,lip of pan pours nicely.With butter,oils or sprays always great results and easy clean up. Try this pan, buy a lid, spatter gaurd and if your concerned about handle heat get a silicone cover.You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: pgp

customer_reviews.title: discoloration
customer_reviews.text: I love the looks of these pots and pans and they are great to use. I love the measure lines on the inside of the pots. But they do discolor on the inside bottom of them. Someone said it gives it character....I don't want my pots and pans to have character, I want them to be durable and clean nicely with no discoloration.
customer_reviews.author: AkGrandma

customer_reviews.title: Super, super happy
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic item. Feeling short of words. Doesn’t stick at all. Super easy to clean. No need of steel wool. I do hand washing. I fried eggs, kebabs even used it for warming up leftovers, but nothing sticks. Perfect for person like me who wants things which are easy to clean and no maintenance. You can trust the brand Cuisinart. It’s cool grip handle really remains cool, no need to use potholders when cooking on stove top. Using this product for almost 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unbalanced (Tips Over Empty)
customer_reviews.text: Well made, good looking, stainless Sauce pan BUT it tips over empty as the handle is too heavy for the small pan size. Sometimes it will stay upright empty but mostly it tips over just sitting there. Unbalanced design needs a re design.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These seemed awesome and beautiful when they arrived, but after a few uses they started getting black spots in the metal are awful to clean!! No one wants to use them... Such a water!!! I've since purchased and used copper chef and love them so much more (light weight, easy to cook with with even heat and super easy to clean)!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lovely Layla

customer_reviews.title: Rusted first use
customer_reviews.text: Pot is beautiful,HOWEVER....I boiled water for pasta in it and the first use it developed rust spots and a burn mark!!! Horrible quality control!!
customer_reviews.author: Ritta

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an Ikea pot that I've had for 10+ years. Doing well so far. It is pictured next to a 1.5 quart pot for reference. It is deep which helps reduce splatter and I haven't had any staining or burning issues yet. Had it for a couple of months now. Definitely recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Garcia

customer_reviews.title: My favorite piece of cookware!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to complete my set of stainless steel cookware and it's the perfect addition. We're pescatarians and I'm able to cook all our meat in this one while preparing the rest of the food in the other cookware. Makes dinner easy and cleanup is fast. Stainless steel is super easy to clean if you know how to cook in it and use the right cleaning tools. It just takes a little getting used to for the beginner by stick with it and your meals will cook faster and come out perfect. Definitely my favorite piece of cookware.
customer_reviews.author: KGreen

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first stainless cookware I've ever tried. I chose this one as my starter because the size and price were reasonable in case I hated it. I'm still trying to figure it out, but the skillet itself is beautiful and seems well made. I know there are more expensive brands out there, but this one seems great to me for this price point. It's an excellent size for me in learning how to use stainless, and it cleans up nicely - even for me, someone who doesn't know how to use it right yet. The best part is that the lids to all my other Cuisinart cookware (Chef's Classic Nonstick Hard-Anodized 17-Piece Cookware Set) fit perfectly on it!
customer_reviews.author: TolyG

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan but not for induction cooking!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my induction burner but it didn't work on it. I thought of sending it back, but I bought an electric burner instead. We are redoing our kitchen, so I don't have a stove at the moment or not one that is hooked up ;( anyway. I got the induction burner on Amazon to use in the meantime, but then I realized all my Cuisinart and Calphalon cookware won't work on it. I needed a medium-sized pot and bought this one. I do love it though, and it looks very nice. Cooked dried beans and sausage in it and had no trouble cleaning it to its original shine. Very nice for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Libby  Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, nice looking and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This little pot makes me smile when I use it. I don't have to dig my (much) larger pot out. It's easy to clean and just seems to make the food taste better (probably because I needed a new pot anyway). It's great to serve food from right at the table. The glass lid is great, too. Good choice.
customer_reviews.author: mona mia

customer_reviews.title: I have several Cuisinart pots and pans and this is a fine product. Even if things are burned it wipes ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift. I have several Cuisinart pots and pans and this is a fine product. Even if things are burned it wipes clean easily... which is a big deal if your used to cooking with non-stick, Teflon products. We like the size as it is perfect for soups and sauces.
customer_reviews.author: Daffodil

customer_reviews.title: Best pans I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I have had these now for 2 years I use them almost everyday and tbey are the best purchase I've ever made. They look just as nice and new as the day I receieved them. They cook food evenly and honestly if you follow the guidelines such as make sure pan is hot (water sizzles when dropped in) nothing truly sticks to it. Also when done cooking add some water to bottom of pan and voila its rinse out without scrubbing. So glad I made the switch from teflon to Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS POT!
customer_reviews.text: I had never owned Contour pans before,, but I am so loving using these. I put full roast dinners in them, and slow-cook making my own TV dinners & Freezing them. I've used them for browning and even straight into the oven. I am seriously pleased with the contour so it gives you that little extra room for turning things over inside. I want more of them, in other sizes!!
customer_reviews.author: Febbie

customer_reviews.title: works okay, wish it were heavier
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight compared with my similar Cuisinart 18/10 bonded heat base skillet. I will keep it, but it feels almost cheap. It's better than some, however, and it works well for my breakfast skillet. I use these stainless-steel skillets for eggs and sauteed vegetables. I wish I had gone to TJMaxx where I bought the Cuisinart, so I could have hefted the weight before buying. Their prices are comparable and they carry all levels of quality in cookware (not necessarily every week--that's their drawback).
customer_reviews.author: St. Fern

customer_reviews.title: You need to know or learn how to cook with stainless... but you really don't know whats in Teflon
customer_reviews.text: Im new to stainless steel but Im learning and I like it. I may adjust my review later. One thing I don't like is the edges where the lids meet. Its not sharp but a very fine edge, about like the back side of a butter knife. And when you wash them in the sink the edge causes the water to fly every where.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M. Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: All Good except Lid handle is metal
customer_reviews.text: A good pan with good construction. Only reason i gave it a three-star is that the handle attached to the glass lids heats up because it's metal, so you have to hold it with gloves. If that doesn't bother you then it's a good pan. Got the 1-Quart, a good small size for small quick meals.
customer_reviews.author: Gg

customer_reviews.title: Much Lighter, and Easier to use than MultiClad Pro :)
customer_reviews.text: I own a Cuisinart 2 quart MultiClad saucepan but it was so heavy to pour water out when it was full. My hand shakes when I'm holding the pan with boiling water. I bought this one for pasta/noodles and it has been perfect for me. I assume the heat distribution is not as good the MultiClad Pro, but I couldn't notice the difference for boiling food in it. It's so much easier to drain pasta, and that's what I noticed. It drains well, no problems found. I think I will only use the MultiClad pan when this one is already in use for cooking other food.
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Appearance is very appealing, but more than that...it serves it's purpose as a wonderful stock pot for making the best product to can/freeze/preserve, which is why I bought it...I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: ME.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and heats evenly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a Revereware dutch oven that had developed a curve to the bottom over decades of use and thus rattled on the glass cooktop. Very well made and just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Impera Magna

customer_reviews.title: Great, But .......
customer_reviews.text: All is great quality and I love it. The pot handle not get hot even after 5 minutes boiling the content like water. However, the lid handle gets VERY hot under the same condition ! It should have been insulated like some other pan and pots.
customer_reviews.author: parviz keyanpour-rad

customer_reviews.title: Good little pot
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 1 qt pot with lid as the 1 qt. with my Caphalon set doesn't have one. This seems well made. I like the shape of the pot and the thick bottom. The stainless steel seems to be good quality and so far, has washed up bright and shiny. The only thing I'm a little apprehensive about is the glass lid. While it's nice to be able to view what I'm cooking, it makes alarming popping and cracking noises when heating up or cooling down. Maybe this is normal but I keep expecting it to shatter, just like the glass lid of a rice cooker did a while ago.
customer_reviews.author: Casey P.

customer_reviews.title: I've had these pots since January and I really love them! They clean so nicely and easily
customer_reviews.text: I've had these pots since January and I really love them! They clean so nicely and easily. They heat evenly and honestly, stuff doesn't really stick to them much. They look as shiny and beautiful as the day I got them! I almost always wash them in the dishwasher
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: Size is great for me, handles get hot.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pot to do pasta boilling or stock, and the size works great with 2 adults. My complaint is, the handles are very close to body of pot and it gets warm/hot very quickly. This condradicts with product description that handles stay cool. However, with this price range, I haven't found stock pots with stainless handles that really stay cool, except for longer handle. The wall is very thin as well.
customer_reviews.author: carefulbuy

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched to all stainless steel cookware in my home not only for the health of my family but because we are purchasing a parakeet and teflon is terrible for them and if it's terrible for them it can't be good for anyone else so we made the switch. I like all the pans I purchased but just be aware that it takes awhile to get used to them. I have to cook everything on a much lower heat these days and things will burn to the bottom and leave some unfortunate markings if you aren't careful! But all in all I am adjusting to it and am happy I made the switch
customer_reviews.author: LisaMcCormick

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Its a very sacepan..only difficulty is the handle ..when compare to the pan weight the handle is not up to the mark it should be more heavy to manage the weight of the pan. over all its a good item. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: smarintl

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart 8-inch open skillet - good purchase - bought two Cuisinarts!
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart 8-inch open skillet - overall I love it. About what I expect weight and quality-wise. Only slight issue is that it was a little smaller than I anticipated. Because of this, I also ordered the Cusinart 10-inch open skillet. I guess you can say it's a "win-win" situation because I love them both.
customer_reviews.author: twoemjay

customer_reviews.title: Lovely, but be aware
customer_reviews.text: pretty and the right size but bottom inside pitted the first time I used it! Amazon replaced
customer_reviews.author: JoeH

customer_reviews.title: IT pours wonderful
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave 4 stars was because the first time I washed it before use it scratched. I only have one of my left hand, and when making sauces its great
customer_reviews.author: shy

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE.. POOR QUALITY AND RUSTED AND
customer_reviews.text: I received the 5 qt. Cuisinart Saute' pan Today. Opened the box and saw that the pan had rust on the handle and the inside of the pan and also had 3 dents and was pitted 3 other places on the inside of the pan. BUYER BEWARE.. POOR QUALITY MERCHANDISE. WILL NOT RECOMMEND .👎
customer_reviews.author: Rich and Theresa, New Cumberland,Pa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a pot that we could put in the oven to replace a glass one that we had that broke. This is perfect! Great size!
customer_reviews.author: M&T Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot
customer_reviews.text: Size is great. Holds liquid very well while cooking. Only downside, handle gets hot. Will need potholder or the like.
customer_reviews.author: Roadrunner

customer_reviews.title: Great Amazon Warehouse Deal
customer_reviews.text: If you are second guessing ordering from "amazon warehouse", don't, the products are literally brand new, just damage to the box. I needed new pots/pans and wanted a good quality set, but didn't want to blow 100's of dollars after just buying a house. I found this set on a warehouse deal and thought it was too good to be true, but it wasn't. I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Heather P

customer_reviews.title: Looked used
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this saucer has been used. It came packaged as if it was brand new but it has little dots on the inside and some other marks that make it seem used. I’m not happy because I don’t want to go through the hassle of returning it and especially because I need to use it right now but I hate feeling like I just paid full price for something that’s not new.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money I paid for this pot.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a heavy duty pot like I already have without the non-stick coating and needed to be dishwasher safe. This pot is very light weight, it has started to pit on the bottom. I don't think it is safe to use any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Loftus

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this pan set in July & already had to throw away the two frying pans. They were horrible, everything stuck to them and cooking was impossible with them. Complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Rosenkranz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and love the lid.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite sauce pan. I just wish it was easier to clean. It shows stains or metal utensil scratches after a short time.
customer_reviews.author: baxter710

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful piece of cookwear
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this Dutch oven. It is a bit smaller than other Dutch ovens or stockpots that I have, but that is just what I needed. I love the stay-cool handles that are a feature on this and many other Cuisinart pieces. The handles do not heat up unless they are right over the stovetop burner unit or you put the pot into the oven (another great feature - it doubles as a large deep casserole when cooking for a crowd).
customer_reviews.author: Doris H

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good quality pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quality pan. The heat spreads evenly, the food never sticks to it and it is very easy to clean. Also, it has an attractive design, so it can taken to the table, serving the food directly from it. Good product, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: E. P.

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love this stockpot. I will be ordering 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great size for soups!
customer_reviews.text: Great for making big pots of soup. Cooks evenly. A bit big for every day, but great to have for company!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love the glass lid, the pour spouts with the smaller and larger strainers. the size and shape works well for the dishes I like to prepare in it.
customer_reviews.author: Precise

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel‘s best friend
customer_reviews.text: The pan in itself is very good. It can get dirty very quickly. Obviously things stick. But the best way to clean it is with Barkeepers Friend. It refreshers like new.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Arnold

customer_reviews.title: A sexy looking pot! Not so deep that I can’t stir all the way to the bottom but still holds alot
customer_reviews.text: Love this pot! It’s SEXY too! Looks stylish and a good size. I’m a canner and was looking for a big pot that wasn’t so tall that I couldn’t get the spoon all the way to the bottom to stir or stand on my tippy toes to reach into it.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Choose another.  All-Clad is worth it.
customer_reviews.text: So so. I cook. I used to professionally. This is too challenging to clean. I live on the ocean, so the stainless bit helps, tho there's no reason for it to be this challenging to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M.

customer_reviews.title: Okay as a stovetop pot if you don't mind the pitting
customer_reviews.text: I was moved by the many positive reviews to buy this “Dutch” oven despite its thin walls and a prior review that noted “pitting.” The thin walls make it a poor choice to cook food in the oven by holding the heat and then keeping and distributing an even temperature while the oven turns on and off. I had hoped that the “pitting” problem was a fluke but after two uses mine showed numerous small pits in the interior bottom and I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope

customer_reviews.title: Well, I should have ordered a bigger size skillet..
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with this product. I just have ordered an incorrect sized skillet. I thought 8" was enough for cooking fish... but I was wrong. My wife wanted a bigger sized skillet, like 12"... But it was as twice as expensive, so I made a stupid decision.. So, to all non-cooking people... If you want to buy something for your partner who cooks for you and knows about cooking, please ASK them first.
customer_reviews.author: UK

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan to add to your Kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: This pan is great! I bought it to replace a non-stick Teflon coated pan. You just need a little oil in the bottom and things like pancakes or eggs cook terrific and they slide right off. Just be careful on the heat level you use. This pan heats up hot and fast. I only have to use medium heat or lower to cook with this pan. Clean up is a snap and the pan is light weight too. It is perfect and I will be buying more of this style pan in the future.
customer_reviews.author: D.B.

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This pan does not cook very well and the heat distribution is awful. I would not recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Panda

customer_reviews.title: Super pleased with the quality and performance of this product
customer_reviews.text: Super pleased with the quality and performance of this product. I’ve needed a Dutch oven and wanted a reliable product without the huge price tag. This is perfect for my needs. I’ve cooked roast for a family of four, soups, stews, whole chicken, and vegetables in this since it arrived. Easy to clean and looks shiny brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Lori LaFave

customer_reviews.title: Now that I have learnt how to cook with stainless ...
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have learnt how to cook with stainless steel, I will not go back to non-stick pans again.
customer_reviews.author: Kanga

customer_reviews.title: Great 8" Skillet for Gas or Electric but NOT Induction capable
customer_reviews.text: This is a Beautiful to look at skillet. It works well on my electric stove and with the usual SS rules it works like a dream. BUT, it turns out the Cuisinart "Classic" and "Contour" lines, while Stainless Steel, do NOT work on my Induction Cooktop. My fault for not checking the reviews closer. I will be buying another SS 8" skillet that will work on the hob and give this to my son. Amazon did great with price and shipping.
customer_reviews.author: mikef

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot. It cooks very evenly and, short of burning, cleans up as easily as non-stick. I especially appreciate the glass lid; I like to see what I'm cooking without uncovering it. And it's pretty enough to display. This is the second one I've owned. After five years of great service, I destroyed it through my own inattention. I am so pleased to have the exact same pot again.
customer_reviews.author: Toni H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality pan
customer_reviews.text: Great little pan perfect for cooking for one or two people. Handle does not heat up.
customer_reviews.author: Carvo

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to 44-13 Contour Set
customer_reviews.text: Had to have this to go with the 44-13 contour set (13-Piece Cookware Set) which did not have a large pot. Nice fit and finish of the lid. All metal construction allows for use in the oven. A bit difficult to clean as compared to tyflon coated but much better heat tranferance when used on electric element or induction cook tops. Haven't used on open flame, so I can not comment on that. Looks good enought to serve right out of the pot.
customer_reviews.author: AZ SME

customer_reviews.title: Value!
customer_reviews.text: Great little saucepan - works almost as well as my All Clad stuff which is super expensive.
customer_reviews.author: John Aron

customer_reviews.title: Not altogether happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I purchased had marks in the bottom the first time I used it for pasta. They looked like pit marks and I could not get them out. I used the suggested cleaning methods which came with the pan but nothing worked. I returned it and purchased a 1 1/2 quart pot because the size was okay but it developed the same marks as soon as I cooked pasta. I have kept the second one and use it, but the marks remain. I like that they are nice heavy pots and the 3 quart one is perfect. I have no problem with that one. I'm not sure I would purchase Cusinart again.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Garber

customer_reviews.title: The Best Saute Pan Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot! It's deep, easy to handle and inexpensive for the quality. This was my first Cuisinart Product.
customer_reviews.author: Fay

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Do not cook on heat higher than med, anything will stick including butter.
customer_reviews.author: Juquatta

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I use it everyday. I love those measuring lines on the inside! Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Shallow
customer_reviews.text: The pan is shallow but it’s great quality. It’s my first stainless pan and it’s been easy to care for. Makes perfect eggs.
customer_reviews.author: layah

customer_reviews.title: Late Bloomer
customer_reviews.text: Did I have to wait until my 50s to buy my first high quality cookware? No, I did not, but I'm glad I finally did. The weight, feel, and appearance of these saucepans makes cooking a pleasure. Love the glass lid, so I can check that simmer level without letting out heat. And they don't break the bank, really. Go ahead and treat yourself.
customer_reviews.author: JShack

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had seen these sooner
customer_reviews.text: I have used these two time now an I just love them I sure wish I had gotten them sooner
customer_reviews.author: Leigh M.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pan
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pan. It is the one I always look for when I want to fry up something. Have had it for almost a year and it still looks good and shiny, except for where I scratched it trying to clean it. I was impatient and started digging at the burnt egg residue. Since then I figured out that all I have to do is fill it with hot soapy water and let it sit for a while. I wish I could afford to buy a whole matching set of these in different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Blake

customer_reviews.title: They are very nice and clean up very well
customer_reviews.text: We have a set of these pots and pans. They are very nice and clean up very well. We had another set about 20 years ago but they did not clean up as easily as these do. I used to never use the pans for frying because the cleanup was impossible - I always used our cast iron pans instead, but this new set does not have that issue. Even the worst looking cooked-on grease comes off easily with soap and warm water. I highly recommend all of this cookware set and am glad we bought them.
customer_reviews.author: book lover

customer_reviews.title: Great little pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan is very solid. The aluminum-clad bottom heats quickly. It works great for heating refried beans on the stovetop (my main use - my wife heats other things as well). I use a lower heat with it than I used to with my previous non-stick pan. We decided to get rid of all of our non-stick pans due to concern over the teflon material (can get into bloodstream and cause sickness) for us and our children. We ordered three Cuisanart pans to replace the non-sticks. All three are very nice. This little pan will be used for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Quercus Alba

customer_reviews.title: Great for cooking pasta
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I want it to... cook and drain pasta easily. Would be nice to have a smaller size for smaller families.
customer_reviews.author: kATHLEEN mEYERS

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pan.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful pot to cook in. I have always liked stainless steel pans instead of the no stick type. The size is just right and I have browned meat in it with no sticking. You just have to remember not to cook on too high of heat. I really like the style of the contour pan. It looks expensive, it is made well, and cleans easily. I also have no problem with the lid. I want to get some other pieces from the contour line.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn from Missouri

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple other Cuisinart pieces I bought several years ago. This piece is the right size and shape for soups and pasta sauces, and gets used almost daily. The lid is a good fit and I like that I can check if my sauce or soup is boiling without having to remove it to peak. I have had no problems cleaning the pan. Just what I was looking for at just the right price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: what is shown is not product
customer_reviews.text: I specifically wanted the tall contoured product shown in the pictures. I was sent an average 1-quart saucepan. It is contoured but I specifically wanted the taller version shown in the amazon pictures. This product is nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Van Le

customer_reviews.title: This is wonderful cookware
customer_reviews.text: I am not very cookware savvy and thought I would splurge on a nicer piece rather than from a big box store. I am glad I did. This is a very good piece of cookware, heats evenly and quickly. My only concern (and I don't know if this matters) is after about a month the inside bottom of the pan developed these little black spots about the size of a pin head. Not very many. It doesn't seem to affect performance so I'm not complaining. That's the only reason I gave it a "like" versus a "love".
customer_reviews.author: Lethe

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Needed this size. Just perfect. Lighter than my more expensive pots, but I really just use for boiling vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Love a large saute' pan
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! Love a large saute' pan. Got rid of my nonstick due to the chemicals used on the nonstick surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

product_meta.title: Cuisinart Contour Stainless 5-Quart Dutch Oven with Glass Cover
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Dutch Oven| Size:5-Quart

Contour Stainless is premium cookware that features professional construction - an aluminum disc in the base is bonded to a stainless interior and a stainless exterior - a fusion of the best materials for cooking, offering unsurpassed performance. The aluminum encapsulated base maintains even heat distribution, eliminating hot spots. Premium stainless steel cooking surfaces do not react with food or alter natural flavors. Elegant styling and a robust silhouette make for a professional look - cook with added flair with this unique cookware.

 * Classic Stainless Performance: Stainless steel surface doesn’t react with food or alter flavors – the most elegant and efficient cooking material.
 * Superior Heat Distribution: Pure aluminum-encapsulated base heats up quickly and enables even heat distribution for consistent results. No more hot spots!
 * Keep Cooking Cool: Maintain a solid grip with the always cool, always secure stick handles, contoured to your hand for extra comfort.
 * Convenient Tempered Glass Covers: Sleek, flat glass lids with stainless rims seal in moisture and flavor. Glass is tempered for durability to ensure lasting performance.
 * Ultimate Cooking Versatility: Oven and broiler safe. Freezer safe for easy food storage.
 * Dishwasher Safe
feature_bullets: Oven and broiler safe; freezer safe for easy food storage
Tempered glass ensures durability; sleek, flat glass lids with stainless rims seal in moisture and flavor
Pure aluminum-encapsulated base heats up quickly and enables even heat distribution for consistent results
Stay-cool comfortable stick handle contoured to your hand for extra comfort
Stainless steel surface doesn’t react with food or alter flavors; dishwasher safe

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,833 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
